revised_title: Structural Rearrangements and Protein Processing in Bacteriophage T4 Head Maturation
tldr: The authors study the maturation process of the head of bacteriophage T4, focusing on the structural rearrangements and processing of its protein constituents. They find that the major head protein P23 undergoes cleavage, which leads to a structural rearrangement of the surface lattice. This process is essential for the maturation of the bacteriophage head, and the authors provide evidence that it is controlled by genes 21 and 24.
